posts.post_content:
Appealing to fellow collectors to slay my personal "white whale" in collecting, a T227 Series of Champions Cobb.  

I'm currently building up a Cobb collection but, even before that, the T227 Cobb was the card that drew me back into collecting 4 years ago.  Saw one at a local card show and was hooked back into collecting just like that.

Looking for an SGC or PSA-graded example, ranging from 1.5 to a 4.  Eye appeal is important, but for the 1.5's and 2's, creasing is of course ok.  Paper loss and dark staining would probably be the only deal breakers.  Will pay a premium for a nice-for-grade example.  Method of payment is your choice.

Card will be going to a fellow collector, with no chance of leaving my personal collection in the foreseeable future.
The Honest Long Cut Cobb (PSA 1) that went for $836 in the BST auction last night was OK for the price. I couldn't justify one more bump.

[quote name="Wildfireschulte" post=1517164]The Honest Long Cut Cobb (PSA 1) that went for $836 in the BST auction last night was OK for the price. I couldn't justify one more bump.[/QUOTE]

Agreed -- very decent for the grade.  I was worried I had lost out, as I only got back from vacation in S.C. around Midnight last night, but it's probably just a step below what I'm looking for.  Thanks though -- I had missed that one completely!  :D
i sent an email to a member who has one
Took me a long time to land this one, but even longer to find a nice Baker to complete the baseball set of these.  Good luck!

*sigh*  You guys are killing me!  :D

They're both precisely what I'm looking for.  The search continues...

Pre-National bump.  

Still looking for this personal white whale.  

Thanks!
